name: aberrantly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is different from what is normal or usual: Bats that end up being tested for rabies are generally those that behave aberrantly. This cell-death process is required for the normal development of the nervous system, but it can be aberrantly activated in neurodegenerative diseases.
More examplesFewer examplesA large number of proteins have been found in excess or to be aberrantly expressed in muscle cells in these patients. The company has experienced an aberrantly strong first quarter.The college has produced an aberrantly high number of senior judges.The researchers found some aberrantly plumaged specimens of the bird.
